segment.source: robstack - V2 of Manage license agreements for computers
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Manage license agreements for computers

segment.source: robstack - V2 of Manage license agreements for computers
segment.target: robstack - V2 of Manage license agreements for computers

segment.source: lets you add and manage license agreement information for software that was purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft software that was purchased by other means.
segment.target: lets you add and manage license agreement information for software that was purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements, and for Microsoft or non-Microsoft software that was purchased by other means.

segment.source: You can also organize this information into logical groups.
segment.target: You can also organize this information into logical groups.

segment.source: This feature is provided for convenience only and accuracy is not guaranteed.
segment.target: This feature is provided for convenience only and accuracy is not guaranteed.

segment.source: You should not rely on it to confirm compliance with Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.
segment.target: You should not rely on it to confirm compliance with Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.

segment.source: Microsoft will not use any data gathered to investigate potential violations of, or compliance with license agreements you may have with us.
segment.target: Microsoft will not use any data gathered to investigate potential violations of, or compliance with license agreements you may have with us.

segment.source: Licenses you add to do not affect your license agreements or entitlements to use your software.
segment.target: Licenses you add to do not affect your license agreements or entitlements to use your software.

segment.source: For example, deleting a license/agreement pair from , you do not delete or nullify license agreements that exist between you and Microsoft.
segment.target: For example, deleting a license/agreement pair from , you do not delete or nullify license agreements that exist between you and Microsoft.

segment.source: In the Licenses workspace of the administrator console, you can:
segment.target: In the Licenses workspace of the administrator console, you can:

segment.source: Add and edit Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements
segment.target: Add and edit Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements

segment.source: Add and edit other software licensing agreements
segment.target: Add and edit other software licensing agreements

segment.source: Manage licenses and groups
segment.target: Manage licenses and groups

segment.source: Compare the entitlement information that retrieves from the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) to the inventory of Microsoft software that detects on your managed Windows PCs.
segment.target: Compare the entitlement information that retrieves from the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) to the inventory of Microsoft software that detects on your managed Windows PCs.

segment.source: Additionally, you can generate reports that show installation and license counts for software titles.
segment.target: Additionally, you can generate reports that show installation and license counts for software titles.

segment.source: License reports can help you assess your complete license position for Microsoft software and non-Microsoft software titles.
segment.target: License reports can help you assess your complete license position for Microsoft software and non-Microsoft software titles.

segment.source: The Licenses workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you are managing at least one Windows PC with the computer client.
segment.target: The Licenses workspace is not displayed in the administrator console until you are managing at least one Windows PC with the computer client.

segment.source: Add Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements
segment.target: Add Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements

segment.source: Volume Licensing agreements provide license information for software that was purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.
segment.target: Volume Licensing agreements provide license information for software that was purchased through Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.

segment.source: You can add Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements to by providing matched pairs of agreement numbers.
segment.target: You can add Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements to by providing matched pairs of agreement numbers.

segment.source: The agreement or authorization numbers must be matched to the correct license or enrollment numbers.
segment.target: The agreement or authorization numbers must be matched to the correct license or enrollment numbers.

segment.source: Agreement number pairs are obtained when you purchase your license agreements from the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).
segment.target: Agreement number pairs are obtained when you purchase your license agreements from the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).

segment.source: To add a Microsoft Volume Licensing agreement
segment.target: To add a Microsoft Volume Licensing agreement

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Licenses.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Licenses.

segment.source: On the Add Agreements page, under Choose Agreement Type, select Volume Licensing agreement.
segment.target: On the Add Agreements page, under Choose Agreement Type, select Volume Licensing agreement.

segment.source: In the Add Agreement Details section, choose one of:
segment.target: In the Add Agreement Details section, choose one of:

segment.source: Upload a CSV file that contains agreement details - Click Browse and select the CSV file you want to upload.
segment.target: Upload a CSV file that contains agreement details - Click Browse and select the CSV file you want to upload.

segment.source: The file can contain either two or three columns; two for agreement pairs alone, or three if you want to add a friendly name for each agreement pair.
segment.target: The file can contain either two or three columns; two for agreement pairs alone, or three if you want to add a friendly name for each agreement pair.

segment.source: The total number of characters in an agreement number pair cannot exceed 16 ASCII characters.
segment.target: The total number of characters in an agreement number pair cannot exceed 16 ASCII characters.

segment.source: Only ASCII characters are supported.
segment.target: Only ASCII characters are supported.

segment.source: The following characters are not allowed in the agreement name: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.
segment.target: The following characters are not allowed in the agreement name: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.

segment.source: Spaces are allowed in the name.
segment.target: Spaces are allowed in the name.

segment.source: The file name must be no more than 128 characters in length.
segment.target: The file name must be no more than 128 characters in length.

segment.source: The file must contain at least one agreement pair and cannot contain more than 5,000 agreement pairs.
segment.target: The file must contain at least one agreement pair and cannot contain more than 5,000 agreement pairs.

segment.source: Format for the file
segment.target: Format for the file

segment.source: You can create this file by adding your agreement pairs to a plain text document in one of the following formats, depending on the organization type that you have registered with the VLSC.
segment.target: You can create this file by adding your agreement pairs to a plain text document in one of the following formats, depending on the organization type that you have registered with the VLSC.

segment.source: Specify one agreement number pair per line.
segment.target: Specify one agreement number pair per line.

segment.source: Open Value Customers: Agreement number, repeat agreement number, agreement name
segment.target: Open Value Customers: Agreement number, repeat agreement number, agreement name

segment.source: Open Customers: Authorization number, related license number, agreement name
segment.target: Open Customers: Authorization number, related license number, agreement name

segment.source: Select and Enterprise Customers: Agreement number, related enrollment number, agreement name
segment.target: Select and Enterprise Customers: Agreement number, related enrollment number, agreement name

segment.source: The Add Agreements form prompts you to browse for this file when you add a new agreement.
segment.target: The Add Agreements form prompts you to browse for this file when you add a new agreement.

segment.source: The following is an example of .csv file content for an Open Value customer.
segment.target: The following is an example of .csv file content for an Open Value customer.

segment.source: Manually add agreement details - Provide the following information, and then type the agreement number pairs in the Authorization/Agreement number and License/Enrollment/Customer number boxes.
segment.target: Manually add agreement details - Provide the following information, and then type the agreement number pairs in the Authorization/Agreement number and License/Enrollment/Customer number boxes.

segment.source: After you type both numbers, click the Add pair icon to save your numbers, and then optionally add a new pair.
segment.target: After you type both numbers, click the Add pair icon to save your numbers, and then optionally add a new pair.

segment.source: Agreement name - Specify a unique name for the agreement.
segment.target: Agreement name - Specify a unique name for the agreement.

segment.source: The agreement name can have a maximum of 256 characters, and cannot contain the following characters: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.
segment.target: The agreement name can have a maximum of 256 characters, and cannot contain the following characters: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.

segment.source: Spaces are allowed in the name.
segment.target: Spaces are allowed in the name.

segment.source: Authorization/Agreement number - Enter the authorization/agreement number of the license pair.
segment.target: Authorization/Agreement number - Enter the authorization/agreement number of the license pair.

segment.source: License/Enrollment/Customer number - Enter the license/enrollment/customer number of the license pair.
segment.target: License/Enrollment/Customer number - Enter the license/enrollment/customer number of the license pair.

segment.source: If you add several agreement number pairs, creates one agreement with the name that you specify, and all pairs that you added will be a part of this agreement.
segment.target: If you add several agreement number pairs, creates one agreement with the name that you specify, and all pairs that you added will be a part of this agreement.

segment.source: You can click + to add another agreement number pair, or - to remove an agreement number pair you have already entered.
segment.target: You can click + to add another agreement number pair, or - to remove an agreement number pair you have already entered.

segment.source: In the Select License Group area, do one of the following:
segment.target: In the Select License Group area, do one of the following:

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to the Unassigned Agreements group if you do not want to add the new agreements to a license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to the Unassigned Agreements group if you do not want to add the new agreements to a license group.

segment.source: You can edit the agreement later if you decide to add it to a group.
segment.target: You can edit the agreement later if you decide to add it to a group.

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to a new license group to add the new agreements to a new license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to a new license group to add the new agreements to a new license group.

segment.source: You are prompted to provide a name for the new license group.
segment.target: You are prompted to provide a name for the new license group.

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to an existing license group to add the new agreements to an existing license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to an existing license group to add the new agreements to an existing license group.

segment.source: In the Group name list, select the license group to which you want to add the agreements.
segment.target: In the Group name list, select the license group to which you want to add the agreements.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: The All Agreements view is displayed, and connects to the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center to validate the agreement number pairs that you provided.
segment.target: The All Agreements view is displayed, and connects to the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center to validate the agreement number pairs that you provided.

segment.source: To update the volume license information after you have added license agreements in , in the Licenses Overview page, click Refresh Now.
segment.target: To update the volume license information after you have added license agreements in , in the Licenses Overview page, click Refresh Now.

segment.source: This action retrieves the current license information from the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).
segment.target: This action retrieves the current license information from the Microsoft Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC).

segment.source: Until you refresh the volume licensing information, you may see different information in the agreements list and the entitlement information on the Agreements Overview page.
segment.target: Until you refresh the volume licensing information, you may see different information in the agreements list and the entitlement information on the Agreements Overview page.

segment.source: After you refresh the volume license information, you can compare the license information to your detected Microsoft software in the Apps workspace.
segment.target: After you refresh the volume license information, you can compare the license information to your detected Microsoft software in the Apps workspace.

segment.source: You can also run the following license reports:
segment.target: You can also run the following license reports:

segment.source: License Purchase Reports - Lets you view the licensed software in license groups you select to help you find gaps in coverage.
segment.target: License Purchase Reports - Lets you view the licensed software in license groups you select to help you find gaps in coverage.

segment.source: License Installation Reports - Helps you determine if you have sufficient license agreement coverage.
segment.target: License Installation Reports - Helps you determine if you have sufficient license agreement coverage.

segment.source: The Product Title displayed for all Microsoft Volume License agreements is Not available.
segment.target: The Product Title displayed for all Microsoft Volume License agreements is Not available.

segment.source: Add and edit other software licensing agreements
segment.target: Add and edit other software licensing agreements

segment.source: You can also add other types of license agreements to in addition to Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.
segment.target: You can also add other types of license agreements to in addition to Microsoft Volume Licensing agreements.

segment.source: These agreements can include non-Microsoft software or Microsoft software that was purchased through a retailer.
segment.target: These agreements can include non-Microsoft software or Microsoft software that was purchased through a retailer.

segment.source: You must have at least one Windows PC enrolled in before you can add an agreement.
segment.target: You must have at least one Windows PC enrolled in before you can add an agreement.

segment.source: In addition, at least one enrolled computer must have uploaded a licensable software package that you want to use to add a license agreement.
segment.target: In addition, at least one enrolled computer must have uploaded a licensable software package that you want to use to add a license agreement.

segment.source: To add other software agreements
segment.target: To add other software agreements

segment.source: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Licenses.
segment.target: In the Microsoft Intune administrator console, click Licenses.

segment.source: Click Add Agreements in the Other Software Licensing Agreements section.
segment.target: Click Add Agreements in the Other Software Licensing Agreements section.

segment.source: Select Other software licensing agreement in the Choose Agreement Type section of the Add Agreements page.
segment.target: Select Other software licensing agreement in the Choose Agreement Type section of the Add Agreements page.

segment.source: In the Add Agreement Details area, specify the following:
segment.target: In the Add Agreement Details area, specify the following:

segment.source: Agreement name (required).
segment.target: Agreement name (required).

segment.source: The agreement name can have a maximum of 256 characters, and cannot contain the following characters: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.
segment.target: The agreement name can have a maximum of 256 characters, and cannot contain the following characters: ~ ! @ # $ ^ & * ( ) = + [ ] { } \ | ; : ' " < > /.

segment.source: Spaces are allowed in the name.
segment.target: Spaces are allowed in the name.

segment.source: Publisher (required).
segment.target: Publisher (required).

segment.source: When you start to type a publisher name, the service retrieves all publisher names that contain the letters that you type.
segment.target: When you start to type a publisher name, the service retrieves all publisher names that contain the letters that you type.

segment.source: For example, if you type “soft,” the service retrieves all publisher names that contain “soft” as part of the name, such as “Microsoft” and “Microsoft Research.”
segment.target: For example, if you type “soft,” the service retrieves all publisher names that contain “soft” as part of the name, such as “Microsoft” and “Microsoft Research.”

segment.source: The publisher names are retrieved from the Software Asset Catalog.
segment.target: The publisher names are retrieved from the Software Asset Catalog.

segment.source: You must select the publisher before you can enter the product title.
segment.target: You must select the publisher before you can enter the product title.

segment.source: Product title (required).
segment.target: Product title (required).

segment.source: When you start to type a product title, the service retrieves all product titles that contain the letters that you type.
segment.target: When you start to type a product title, the service retrieves all product titles that contain the letters that you type.

segment.source: You must specify a Publisher before you can specify a Product title.
segment.target: You must specify a Publisher before you can specify a Product title.

segment.source: License count (required).
segment.target: License count (required).

segment.source: Enter the number of purchased licenses.
segment.target: Enter the number of purchased licenses.

segment.source: License start date.
segment.target: License start date.

segment.source: Enter the start date of license coverage.
segment.target: Enter the start date of license coverage.

segment.source: License end date.
segment.target: License end date.

segment.source: Enter the end date of license coverage.
segment.target: Enter the end date of license coverage.

segment.source: Agreement details.
segment.target: Agreement details.

segment.source: You can optionally specify contact information, registration keys, and other information.
segment.target: You can optionally specify contact information, registration keys, and other information.

segment.source: In the Select License Group area, do one of the following:
segment.target: In the Select License Group area, do one of the following:

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to the Unassigned Agreements group if you do not want to add the new agreements to a new or existing license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to the Unassigned Agreements group if you do not want to add the new agreements to a new or existing license group.

segment.source: You can add the agreements to user-defined license groups at any time.
segment.target: You can add the agreements to user-defined license groups at any time.

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to a new license group to add the new agreements to a new license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to a new license group to add the new agreements to a new license group.

segment.source: You are prompted to provide a name for the new license group.
segment.target: You are prompted to provide a name for the new license group.

segment.source: Select Add the agreements to an existing license group to add the new agreements to an existing license group.
segment.target: Select Add the agreements to an existing license group to add the new agreements to an existing license group.

segment.source: In the Group name list, select the license group to which you want to add the agreements.
segment.target: In the Group name list, select the license group to which you want to add the agreements.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: The All Agreements list view is displayed.
segment.target: The All Agreements list view is displayed.

segment.source: Manage license agreements
segment.target: Manage license agreements

segment.source: Software licensing agreements can be added to license groups.
segment.target: Software licensing agreements can be added to license groups.

segment.source: You can use license groups to organize your license agreements in units that are logical for your organization.
segment.target: You can use license groups to organize your license agreements in units that are logical for your organization.

segment.source: Additionally, you can delete license agreements which you previously created.
segment.target: Additionally, you can delete license agreements which you previously created.

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details
segment.target: Details

segment.source: Create a license group
segment.target: Create a license group

segment.source: On the Overview page of the Licenses workspace, click Create License Group from the Tasks menu.
segment.target: On the Overview page of the Licenses workspace, click Create License Group from the Tasks menu.

segment.source: Note: You can create a total maximum of 500 license groups.
segment.target: Note: You can create a total maximum of 500 license groups.

segment.source: Rename a license group
segment.target: Rename a license group

segment.source: In the Licenses workspace, choose a license group, and then click Edit License Group from the Tasks Menu.
segment.target: In the Licenses workspace, choose a license group, and then click Edit License Group from the Tasks Menu.

segment.source: Delete a license group
segment.target: Delete a license group

segment.source: In the Licenses workspace, choose a license group, and then click Delete License Group from the Tasks Menu.
segment.target: In the Licenses workspace, choose a license group, and then click Delete License Group from the Tasks Menu.

segment.source: Tip: Any licenses that were in the deleted group are moved to the Unassigned agreements license group.
segment.target: Tip: Any licenses that were in the deleted group are moved to the Unassigned agreements license group.

segment.source: Delete a license agreement
segment.target: Delete a license agreement

segment.source: In the Licenses workspace, choose an agreement, and then click Delete.
segment.target: In the Licenses workspace, choose an agreement, and then click Delete.

segment.source: Tip: After you delete Volume Licensing agreements, to update the license information, click Refresh Now on the Licenses Overview page or on the General tab for a specific license group.
segment.target: Tip: After you delete Volume Licensing agreements, to update the license information, click Refresh Now on the Licenses Overview page or on the General tab for a specific license group.

segment.source: See Also
segment.target: See Also

segment.source: Deploy apps to Windows PCs in Microsoft Intune
segment.target: Deploy apps to Windows PCs in Microsoft Intune
